info.title: Phishing Awareness
info.description: This quiz tests your ability to recognize phishing emails, identify common phishing tactics, and respond appropriately to phishing attempts.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common sign of a phishing email?
options: An email with urgent language asking you to take immediate action
An email from your colleague that you expected
A promotional email from a company you subscribed to
A newsletter from your favorite website
questions.answer: An email with urgent language asking you to take immediate action

questions.question: What is Spear Phishing?
options: A phishing attack targeting a specific individual or organization
A phishing attack that spreads randomly to multiple recipients
An attack that infects a computer with malware
A technique used by hackers to create fake websites
questions.answer: A phishing attack targeting a specific individual or organization

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Clone Phishing?
options: A phishing attack that mimics a previously received legitimate email
A phishing attack where attackers clone an entire website
An attack that duplicates login credentials of an employee
A type of malware that infects a user's system
questions.answer: A phishing attack that mimics a previously received legitimate email

questions.question: How can you verify that a website is legitimate before entering login credentials?
options: Check for a padlock icon and 'https://' in the URL
Click on any links in the email to verify the site
Ensure the website design looks professional
Trust any website that asks for login details
questions.answer: Check for a padlock icon and 'https://' in the URL

questions.question: What should you do if you receive an email that you suspect is a phishing attempt?
options: Click on the link to confirm if it's real
Reply to the sender asking for verification
Report the email to IT or security teams
Forward the email to colleagues to warn them
questions.answer: Report the email to IT or security teams

questions.question: Why should you never click on links or download attachments in unexpected emails?
options: Because they might contain malicious software or redirect to a fake website
Because they take up too much space on your device
Because it's illegal to open links in suspicious emails
Because doing so will automatically report the email as phishing
questions.answer: Because they might contain malicious software or redirect to a fake website

questions.question: What is the best way to protect yourself from phishing scams?
options: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) on your accounts
Use the same password for all online accounts
Never check the sender's email address
Only respond to emails from unknown sources
questions.answer: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) on your accounts

questions.question: What does a phishing website typically do?
options: Tricks users into entering their personal or login information
Protects users from malware
Automatically reports cyber criminals to law enforcement
Redirects users to legitimate banking sites
questions.answer: Tricks users into entering their personal or login information

questions.question: Which of the following is a common phishing tactic used by cybercriminals?
options: Posing as a legitimate company and asking for sensitive information
Sending encrypted emails that contain security alerts
Automatically securing user accounts when they log in
Providing free cybersecurity tools in every phishing email
questions.answer: Posing as a legitimate company and asking for sensitive information

questions.question: If you accidentally click on a phishing link, what should you do immediately?
options: Disconnect from the internet and report the incident to IT
Enter fake login credentials to confuse the hacker
Ignore it and continue working as usual
Forward the phishing link to coworkers to warn them
questions.answer: Disconnect from the internet and report the incident to IT
